content: I have run into some trouble. I have a felt a calling. The calling to serve this great nation (U.S.A.). I am on a strict diet and workout program to get down to the desired rate so that I can have a chance at enlisting in the Marine Corps. But one issue I have run into, that I knew would be a problem, is my right hand. I broke my hand when I was 16 and now my wrist is fused and reenforced with a 7 inch steel plate. Now I can move my fingers and twist my hand, but I can't bend it. They are saying this could prevent me from joining. I want to serve. This country has given so much to me and I want to give back to it. I can do everything anyone else can. My hand hasn't stopped me yet and won't. I am unclear as to what I should do.
